originalText: Bouncer with beard has denied entry of over 6 completely sober patrons who have not had a single drink on multiple seperate occasions, using the "too drunk" excuse excluding entry of a whole group of POC, and allowing a group of clearly inebriated caucasian teenagers in without verification of identification. at this point this feels like a racial issue is at hand between the security and patrons, and this needs to be rectified immediately as this is the fifth night I should have been allowed in and was denied entry for what appears to be my skin color.

Went in at 11pm paid 10$ for me and my friend for cover , one of the bartenders took a photo of us above the dance floor and we left to go get food quick.we went back in around 11:41 By the time we came back my stamp didn’t glow and the lady was telling me they don’t wash off as her was on for 3 weeks. Clearly mine washed off or wasn’t put on correctly, The bouncer said he remembered my friend but not me, we showed them the TIME STAMPED photo of us in stages that night with the same outfits on less then an hour earlier

We paid an extra $5 to get in and the cover lady was rude and yelling at us.

Don’t waste your time going here,

RUDE coat check girls wouldn’t give me my coat despite describing it, also showed them a picture of my number for my coat & they refused to give it to me still. One of them was literally making fun of me for getting upset. Don’t know why they felt the need to pick on me for wanting my coat, probably bored with their life
Went there with the gf and saw the line was down the block and wasnt moving so decided to go to the merchant in stead.

I’ve been going to this place for 9 years now, back in the day it was ran great! Coat check always available, security being actual security and knowing the difference between the rights of guests and workings.
Now it seems they hire security with little to no experience that places power over their job. With a line expanding going into the metro parking lots because they want to let groups of girls cut the line with is compromising the people in the line. I’ve seen not only myself, but other people getting kicked out for standing their ground. If we mention that we noticed they let girls cut, we get threatened to not get let in if we continue to talk about it with the security, told to leave for leaving our jacket in a spot that is secure. ( including over 20+ more jackets) since coat check is not an option any longer, nor has it been with quite some time now which is leading people to find other options to store there jacket. The place gets very hot with the amount of people in the building, so having a thick jacket on is not the healthiest choice.
People get shunned out about tips, not acknowledged, and kicked out for nothing.
You can have a great experience there, if the staff isn’t choosing power over their position, get acknowledged and not kicked out for literally doing NOTHING.
I go to alot of different clubs and I can confidently admit, that this is run by children and not worth spending your money. The security makes the experience not worth it.

Ouch.
Rude.
Aggressive "customer" dudes apparently run the bar. Left after one beer. Strip clubs are supposed to be where we escape stress, not have it piled on.
Bartender's friends were obnoxious and threatening, throwing comments at us from the minute we bought our first beer.
Felt unsafe.
I came to see and spend money on women, not your childhood tree house club.

My main complaints ware the over priced, but Watered down drinks. I ordered a double scotch rocks.  If it had half an ounce of scotch, I’d be surprised. My 2nd drink was the same. $17.50 each. The drink you have to buy for the dancer is $7.50 for water.

The Dancers need to learn how to dance and use the pole.

Great hangout just for the staff (before we even talk about the entertainment)! Ownership is super professional and bar staff are so friendly and always have time to chat. Check it out, soooooo much better than the 'plaza' era!!!!!!

Such a great spot! Went last night for my bachelorette and the club was so clean! The drinks were delicious, the girls were stunning and absolutely on point! They were so sweet and made my first time so memorable! We all had the time of our lives and will ABSOLUTELY be back!
Had to pay a cover fee to enter. The place seemed quite trashy and dirty.

Awful experience here last night. My friend got kicked out because the security confused him for another person. Wouldn’t let us leave with him and made him wait outside in the cold while we grabbed his jacket.  Security guards treated us with disrespect when we didn’t even know what was going on. Someone please teach these security guards how to identify a person and how to use manners.
We built this beautiful structure. Half the bar was in. They loved it. A stupid ugly security guard ruined it in front of Us. This was my library of Alexandria.

Best DJ at any club I've ever been to anywhere. Amazing songs and perfectly timed transitions. Everyone was dancing. I see why Trinity is the best club in Kingston, honestly how embarrassing for stages LOL.

I was delighted to not hear Cotton-Eyed Joe playing at any point in the night 🥰!

THE DJ at trinity is horrible: DJ Shane Sagar, he is horrible, he does not even know how to DJ, music keeps cutting out, and horrible transitions, I went there last night with 50 of my friends to enjoy the night and we left because the DJ was horrible, they should hire a DJ that actually knows how to DJ, and actually switch the songs properly, this is a disappointment and won't be going back until they hire a DJ that can actually DJ. Stages is way better, the DJ can actually DJ. We all left and went there instead! I am giving this place a 0 star due to the horrible DJ.

Worst DJ at any club I've ever been to anywhere. Terrible songs and way too long transitions. No one else was dancing. I see why Stages is the best club in Kingston, honeslty how embarrassing to be worse than them LOL.

the music is good, but they kicked me out when i was genuinely sober. one bouncer said that i was sober, but the manager was power tripping and refused to let me back in˙◠˙ they're pretty strict i guess and honestly it was just not fun:/

How to ensure your guests have a terrible experience at what was supposed to be an excellent Beaches concert:

Step 1. Have a sticky, dusty, dirty venue that's probably about a clean as a truck stop bathroom.
Step 2. Offer General admission for a popular band. (Not that odd but wait for it.)
Step 3. Let everyone into the venue and allow them to go almost wherever they want because, general admission.
Step 4. Go up to some guests who waited in line for nearly an hour and tell them they have to MOVE because that specific area of the balcony is suddenly reserved.
Step 5. Offer absolutely no resolution for this at all, not even an apology.
Step 6. With the venue now packed expect those guests to just figure it out despite it being obvious that they will not be able to see anywhere else at this point.

All in all the manager at The Ale House ruined what was supposed to be a fun night by being completely unprepared for these supposed, at a general admission concert. Completely lacking in the ability to think creatively he basically just said we, along with several other guests who'd also arrived early, were SOL. He offered no apology, not even a free drink. We specifically picked that section of the balcony to avoid being bumped into to too much due to some physical issues. We managed to make it through about 4 of The Beaches songs before having to leave. I hope bands think twice before booking The Ale House in the future.

As an additional note, half the balcony WAS roped off. But for some reason these reservations HAD to be where we already were. And no they weren't VIP ticket holders. So disappointed

If you want a clubbing experience where you spend an hour simply trying to leave the place and get your coat- this is the place for you! ruined our entire night because we just wanted to get the hell out. boycotting ale from now on.

I have been going here for years and have always appreciated that ale is the bar that has food. There is no food right now. I am disgraced. I am angry. I am disappointed. The kitchen staff have always been wonderful and I cannot put into words how upsetting it is to not have the kitchen as an option. I will be telling everyone I know to pick elsewhere until this problem is solved.

Went there for my 19th birthday celebration. I got in but bouncer was rude, then they would not let my girl in after they asked for 3 pieces of I'd. Not the best place to spend your birthday celebration! ps: just go to stages.

Embark on an unforgettable (I kid you not 🚨) experience at the Vienna House in the heart of Kingston, where you can sip on drinks and take a refreshing dip in a pool accompanied by REAL ducks! It's a fun and unique adventure waiting for you! 🍹🦆 10/10 would recommend :)

Very friendly and welcoming staff. They organize excellent birthday parties. Excellent singing skills.
I recommend everyone to plan a visit to the Vienna House on their birthday. Unforgettable experience.
Thanks to all.

Absolutely love the place. Its the place to be in Kingston. 12/10 would recommend visiting this place before going clubbing. I would recommend carrying a duck of any sort to the place.
Enjoy the vibesss

Great nightclub!
Although to get in, you need to be a heavy alcoholic.
Cirhosis of the liver is going to be the result of being a guest there.

However, the staff isn't too friendly. The one guy, Marcel is barely understandable. Some weird sort of accent. Maybe even a disability.

Still had a great time.

Had to buy own furniture, otherwise the only sitting is on the roof.

Some of the staff speak German and sometimes throw stuff at the clients. Weird service
